summary.text: The [android Application](http://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/Application.html) object instance provided to the init of the module.

signatures.code: get packageName(): string
get startActivity(): AppCompatActivity

summary.text: The main (start) Activity for the application.

signatures.code: get foregroundActivity(): AppCompatActivity

summary.text:
The currently active (loaded) [android Activity](http://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/Activity.html).

This property is automatically updated upon Activity events.

signatures.code: get context(): Context
get backgrounded(): boolean
get paused(): boolean
registerBroadcastReceiver( intentFilter: string, onReceiveCallback: (context: Context, intent: Intent) => void ): void

summary.text:
Register a BroadcastReceiver to be run in the main activity thread. The receiver will be called with any broadcast Intent that matches filter, in the main application thread.
For more information, please visit 'http://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Context.html#registerReceiver%28android.content.BroadcastReceiver,%20android.content.IntentFilter%29'
A string containing the intent filter.
A callback function that will be called each time the receiver receives a broadcast.

signatures.code: unregisterBroadcastReceiver(intentFilter: string): void

summary.text:
Unregister a previously registered BroadcastReceiver.
For more information, please visit 'http://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Context.html#unregisterReceiver(android.content.BroadcastReceiver)'
A string containing the intent filter with which the receiver was originally registered.

signatures.code: getRegisteredBroadcastReceiver(intentFilter: string): BroadcastReceiver

summary.text: Get a registered BroadcastReceiver, then you can get the result code of BroadcastReceiver in onReceiveCallback method.
A string containing the intent filter.

signatures.code: on( event: "activityCreated", callback: (args: AndroidActivityBundleEventData) => void, thisArg?: any ): void
on( event: "activityDestroyed", callback: (args: AndroidActivityEventData) => void, thisArg?: any ): void

summary.text: This event is raised when application css is changed.

signatures.code: on( event: "activityStarted", callback: (args: AndroidActivityEventData) => void, thisArg?: any ): void

summary.text: Event raised then livesync operation is performed.

signatures.code: on( event: "activityPaused", callback: (args: AndroidActivityEventData) => void, thisArg?: any ): void

summary.text: This event is raised when application css is changed.

signatures.code: on( event: "activityResumed", callback: (args: AndroidActivityEventData) => void, thisArg?: any ): void

summary.text: This event is raised on application launchEvent.

signatures.code: on( event: "activityStopped", callback: (args: AndroidActivityEventData) => void, thisArg?: any ): void

summary.text:
This event is raised after the application has performed most of its startup actions.
Its intent is to be suitable for measuring app startup times.

signatures.code: on( event: "saveActivityState", callback: (args: AndroidActivityBundleEventData) => void, thisArg?: any ): void

summary.text: This event is raised when the Application is suspended.

signatures.code: on( event: "activityResult", callback: (args: AndroidActivityResultEventData) => void, thisArg?: any ): void

summary.text: This event is raised when the Application is resumed after it has been suspended.

signatures.code: on( event: "activityBackPressed", callback: (args: AndroidActivityBackPressedEventData) => void, thisArg?: any ): void

summary.text: This event is raised when the Application is about to exit.

signatures.code: on( event: "activityNewIntent", callback: (args: AndroidActivityNewIntentEventData) => void, thisArg?: any ): void

summary.text: This event is raised when there is low memory on the target device.

signatures.code: on( event: "activityRequestPermissions", callback: (args: AndroidActivityRequestPermissionsEventData) => void, thisArg?: any ): void

summary.text: This event is raised when an uncaught error occurs while the application is running.

applyCssClass(rootView: View, cssClasses: string[], newCssClass: string): void

summary.text: Applies the the
`newCssClass`
to the
`rootView`
and removes all other css classes from
`cssClasses`
previously applied to the
`rootView`

signatures.code: setMaxRefreshRate(options?: { max?: number; min?: number }): void

summary.text:
iOS Only
Dynamically change the preferred frame rate
For devices (iOS 15+) which support min/max/preferred frame rate you can specify ranges
For devices (iOS < 15), you can specify the max frame rate
see: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/quartzcore/optimizing_promotion_refresh_rates_for_iphone_13_pro_and_ipad_pro
To use, ensure your Info.plist has:

```xml
  <key>CADisableMinimumFrameDurationOnPhone</key>
  <true/>
```
{ min?: number; max?: number; preferred?: number }

signatures.code: loadAppCss(): void

summary.text:
Loads immediately the app.css.
By default the app.css file is loaded shortly after "loaded".
For the Android snapshot the CSS can be parsed during the snapshot generation,
as the CSS does not depend on runtime APIs, and loadAppCss will be called explicitly.
